Get Involved

Code for Kentuckiana was formed to bring people together to make Kentuckiana a better place. Our mission is To organize and advocate for the use of public data and technology to make Louisville and Southern Indiana a more safe, resilient, and equitable place.

To make that happen, we need projects and volunteers. You can see some of the projects we're planning to work on, but the most impactful projects will come from our community. We need you to join us in making things better. If you have a project idea or you want to work on a project you see here, please reach out, we would love your help.

Ways to connect

Slack

Slack is an online tool that allows people to connect and collaborate. Please join the #code-for-kentuckiana channel in Code for America's Slack.

Meetups

Our in person meetups will be posted on Meetup. Please sign up to get notified of our events.

Code

GitHub is where we code collaboratively. Find us on GitHub at https://github.com/codeforkyana

Social Media

Twitter: @CodeForKYana
Facebook: CodeForKYana
Instagram: CodeForKYana
